oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Confederate Circle diagram
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Hand-drawn Confederate Circle diagram from Mt. Olivet Cemetery. In the center of the circle a quote is written, "Here lie the mortal remains of those brave men who were buried where they fell & reinterred 1869."

Mount Olivet Cemetery is a 206-acre cemetery in Nashville, Tennessee. After the Civil War, the Ladies Memorial Society of Nashville purchased land and established the Confederate Circle for approximately fallen 1,500 Confederate soldiers.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Burial; Death and burial; Cemeteries; Mount Olivet Cemetery (Nashville, Tenn.)
